title: 106_s1156
content: The Act may be cited as the "Small Business Advocacy Review Panel Technical Amendments Act of 1999". The Congress recognizes the importance of a thriving small business sector in job creation and acknowledges the regulatory burdens faced by small businesses. The Act aims to facilitate small businesses' participation in the rulemaking process through the Small Business Advocacy Review Panel. The Small Business Advocacy Review Panel process aims to facilitate small businesses' participation in the Federal regulatory process by expanding the number of agencies required to convene panels. SEC. 3. ENSURING FULL ANALYSIS OF POTENTIAL IMPACTS ON SMALL ENTITIES OF RULES PROPOSED BY CERTAIN AGENCIES. Section 609(b) of title 5, United States Code, is amended to require covered agencies to notify the Chief Counsel for Advocacy of the Small Business Administration before publishing an initial regulatory flexibility analysis. This includes providing information on the potential impacts of the proposed rule on small entities and identifying affected small entity representatives within 30 days. The covered agency must notify small entity representatives and provide detailed information for advice on potential impacts of the draft proposed rule. A review panel, consisting of federal employees and regulatory affairs officials, will be convened 30 days after the information is transmitted. The covered agency must notify small entity representatives and provide detailed information for advice on potential impacts of the draft proposed rule. A review panel will be convened to review the material prepared by the agency, collect advice from small entity representatives, and allow them to make oral presentations. The panel must report to the agency head within 60 days on the comments received from the representatives. The review panel's findings on issues related to specific sections must be printed in the Federal Register within 180 days of receiving the report, excluding any confidential business information from small entity representatives. The covered agency must consider modifications suggested by small entity representatives for draft proposed rules. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 609(d) of title 5, United States Code to define 'covered agency' as EPA, OSHA, and IRS, and 'small entity representative' as an entity or individual representing small entities. SEC. 5. Amends Section 601 of title 5, United States Code by revising definitions and removing paragraphs (7) and (8). Also, amends Section 603 regarding interpretative rules involving internal revenue laws. SEC. 6. Specifies the effective date of the Act as 90 days after enactment. The Senate passed S. 1156 on September 28, 1999, amending provisions of the Small Business Regulatory Enforcement Fairness Act of 1996 to ensure full analysis of potential impacts on small entities of rules proposed by certain agencies.
